Abstract: Article on former long jumper Bob Beamon discusses his unhappy childhood growing up in South Jamaica, Queens; notes that his record long jump of 29 feet 2 1/2 inches at 1968 Olympics in Mexico City stood for 23 years; photos (M)
Snippet: Article on former long jumper Bob Beamon discusses his unhappy childhood growing up in South Jamaica, Queens; notes that his record long jump of 29 feet 2 1/2 inches at 1968 Olympics in Mexico City stood for 23 years; photos (M)
LeadParagraph: Through it all -- the Olympic gold medal for the long jump, the world record that stood for 23 years, the private audiences with heads of state -- Bob Beamon always felt like the untouched, unloved, unwanted child he was raised to believe he was.

Headline.PrintHeadline: TRACK AND FIELD; Soothing an Old Ache
